required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Beat Childhood Cancer Specimen Banking and Data Registry
clinical_study.official_title: Specimen Banking With Clinical and Genomic Data Registry With the Establishment of Tumor Models for Pediatric Cancers

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational data registry study of all pediatric cancer patients at Atrium Health (AH) and participating Beat Childhood Cancer Consortium sites involving specimen banking and data collection.

detailed_description.textblock: This observational registry and banking study is being performed on a large cohort of patients who have been identified to receive molecular testing to better understand the relationship between genomic and molecular information and clinical outcomes, enabling timely and informed treatment decisions by physicians for cancer patients. We hypothesize that large gene panels, sequencing (DNA/RNA), and epigenetics of tumors can identify molecular aberrations in tumors that can be leveraged to offer more effective treatment. Findings may suggest additional research will be required to better understand the molecular underpinnings of the relationship between molecular abnormalities and disease. Banked specimens and the creation of tumor cell lines and xenograft models will enable this research to be performed.

primary_outcome.measure: Create a data registry of clinical and molecular/genomic data
primary_outcome.description: Create a data registry of clinical and molecular/genomic data from cancer patients who have undergone biopsy or surgical resection for clinical care to better understand the relationship between genomic and molecular information and clinical outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Determine number and types of genomic alterations within tumor types/subtypes
primary_outcome.description: Define genomic landscape of pediatric cancers through the determination of the number and types of genomic alterations within tumor types/subtypes, across tumor types, and tumor evolution over time.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the rate of actionable genomic alternations
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the rate of actionable genomic alternations resulting in associated targeted therapies relative to all actionable genomic alterations.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the correlation of baseline genomic alterations with clinical outcome.
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the correlation of baseline genomic alterations with clinical outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bank additional specimens available for future research projects
secondary_outcome.description: Bank additional specimens available for future research projects

secondary_outcome.measure: Create cell line and xenograft models of pediatric cancers for future research
secondary_outcome.description: Create cell line and xenograft models of pediatric cancers for future research

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with suspected or confirmed pediatric solid tumors
arm_group.description: Patients with suspected or confirmed pediatric solid tumors

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with suspected or confirmed pediatric solid tumors

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric cancer patients at participating Beat Childhood Cancer Consortium sites

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- No age restrictions
- Patients with suspected or confirmed pediatric solid tumors
- Subject or his/her legally authorized representative (where applicable) signs the study consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient or his/her legally authorized representative (where applicable) did not consent for specimen banking and data collection for this study.

overall_official.affiliation: Beat Childhood Cancer at Atrium Health
